column4: why the package that i install with "dpkg --force" ,don't show in synaptic?
probably beacuse that package is not in the respostiories
yes,it is not in
but ones that install with gdebi show
because gedbi, uses your repository to download/install packages & dependencies
while dpkg you can just find a package anywhere on the net, install it and the package is not in the repository.

to find out what packages you have installed, use this command " dpkg --get-selections "
it is a great project

it display all packages
yes, now you won't forget what you have instaleld
all,all,include througt apt

then use dpkg --list
wzssyaq: shortcuts for finding a certain program(s) instaleld dpkg --get-selections | grep python or dpkg --list | grep "blah" will list all program installed "blah"
